casebody.data:
Dwayne DELESTON, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. NORTH CHARLESTON POLICE DEPARTMENT; James W. Rowan, II; Terry Caulder, Officer, Defendants-Appellees. No. 04-6681. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: Oct. 20, 2004. Decided: Nov. 4, 2004. Dwayne Deleston, Appellant pro se. Before MICHAEL, TRAXLER, and KING, Circuit Judges.

*288Affirmed by unpublished per curiam opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit. See Local Rule 36(c).

PER CURIAM:

Dwayne Deleston appeals the district court’s order accepting the recommendation of the magistrate judge and denying relief on his 42 U.S.C. § 1983 (2000) complaint. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. See Deleston v. North Charleston Police Dep’t, No. CA-04-546 (D.S.C. Mar. 29, 2004). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED
